-Developing Junior Level Engineers into being great Engineers. Experience Level III Customer Support Engineer – HTTS Security Team Cisco Systems March 2006  – Present (9 years 6 months) Richardson, TX Job Description: 
-Primarily responsible for timely acceptance, complete ownership, and drive to resolution of customer reported issues.  
-This includes diagnosing, troubleshooting, and repairing complex Cisco hardware and software products implemented in enterprise and service provider networks. 
-Assist customer's with proactive, implementations and design issues. 
-Research and recommend Security best practices.  
-Provides systems and product training and mentoring to other CSE’s. 
-Utilizes test equipment and configurations in lab for recreating customer problems.  
-Escalate problems to appropriate internal resources and resolve them in a timely manner. -Accurately and completely documents problems and solutions in case notes and bug reports. -Work with diverse virtual teams with global reach.  
-Maintain cool head in situations of extreme duress.  
-Coordinate with with PSIRT team to investigate product vulnerabilities. 
-Partner with with Advances Services teams to provide Network implementations for new products and networks.  
-Work with various Security Business Units to identify areas for product improvement. 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
-Assigned to work on several CAP cases which are the highest level of Cisco technical support engagement for a customer.  
-Worked with Security Product Business Units to identify critical deficiencies and bugs in products which resulted in fewer TAC cases. 
-Championed Kepner-Trego troubleshooting program and helped integrate that into HTTS TAC workflow to lessen time to resolution on cases. 
-Mentored several junior level engineers in my tenure with the Security team. 
-Analyzed HTTS TAC case metrics to determine how to break apart the HTTS Security Team into smaller Technology teams to speed case resolution. 
-Screened new candidates for job openings on the team. 
-Training Coordinator for the Security Team. Level II Customer Support Engineer – HTTS LAN Switching Team Cisco Systems, Inc. February 2003  –  March 2006  (3 years 2 months) Richardson, TX Job Description: 
-Assisted customers with configuration, implementation, and maintenance of Cisco LAN Switching issues equipment and software. 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
Exceeded stretch goals for case handling metrics consistently.  
-Pioneered the role of Focal Engineer while working with Verizon Wireless and Verizon IT. This lead to a new job role called a High Touch Engineer which resulted in increased revenue from differentiated service offerings. 
-Lab advocate for the Richardson office HTTS Lab. Level II Customer Support Engineer – HTTS Large router Architecture Team Cisco Systems, Inc August 2002  –  February 2003  (7 months) Richardson, TX Job Description: 
-Provided front line 24x7 support on Cisco’s Largest routing platforms, including GSR’s and 7600’s.  
-Solved reactive issues for mainly large U.S. Service Providers including S.W. Bell Internet, AT&T, Verizon. 
-Collaborated with with Advanced Services team to provide root cause analysis on large scale outages and deploy preventive measures to prevent further occurrences. 
-Assisted customer engineers to implement configuration changes and provided support for maintenance windows. 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
-Suggested that management form a separate team of entry level engineers to handle hardware only failures which save Cisco money. 
Exceeded stretch goals for customer handling metrics. Level II Customer Support Engineer – Service Provider Support Group Cisco Systems, Inc. August 2000  –  August 2002  (2 years 1 month) Richardson, TX Job Description: 
-Worked with Service Providers on break-fix issues involving routing protocols, router architectures product performance issues and router crashes. 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
-Did a study of product failures for VIP4-80 service blades to prove to the Business Unit that there was a product quality issue with a particular product. 
-Worked with Management to implement Specific customer Cell Team's for critical service providers. Senior Network Design Engineer Aegis Communcations August 1997  –  August 2000  (3 years 1 month) Dallas, TX Job Description: 
-Responsible for design and implementation of LAN/WAN technologies for the Aegis Network.  
-Configured Cisco 2501, 2514, 2524, 2600, 4000, 4500, 7300 Series Routers, and PIX Firewalls. Installed Adtran, Kentrox, and AT&T Paradyne CSU/DSU’s.  
-Can also troubleshoot Telco Company Channel Banks. Installed and upgraded HP Procurve Switches.  
-Experienced troubleshooting WAN technologies including ISDN BRI, Frame-Relay and T1 Data Circuits.  
-Worked extensively with IPX/SPX and TCP/IP protocols.  
-Responsible for maintaining and documenting IP address space for over 200 IP Subnets.  
-Primary customer contact and project management experience for US West Communications encompassing 53 different Host Session and Web Applications.  
-Primary LAN/WAN support person for St Joseph, Elkins, Fairmont, Sierra Vista and Joplin call centers.  
-Designed login scripts, desktop policies, file system and NDS rights structures and login templates in NDS.  
-Performed hardware upgrades and configuration of Dell Power Edge and Compaq Proliant Servers 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
-Built three remote call centers encompassing 2000 desktops, Two dozen Novell servers, HP Switches and Hubs and several Cisco Routers.  
-Installed and upgraded 35 Novell 4.11 Servers.  
-Installed two Windows NT 4.0 Application servers.  
-Worked extensively with NDS Tree design and implementation working with a large NDS Database (over 6,000 NDS Objects).  
-Upgraded Core networks to Fast Ethernet.  
-Installed and maintained four Novell SAA 3.0 SNA Gateways for 3270 connectivity.  
-Designed and installed desktop management solution using Novell ZEN Works to distribute and manage software configurations on over 3500 production desktop systems.  
-Planned and installed redundant systems that allowed 100% uptime for mission-critical LAN platforms, including Vinca Standby-Server and Novell NRS 1.21. Network Analyst CompuNet Support Systems January 1997  –  July 1997  (7 months) Garland, TX Job Description: 
-Supported Novell 4.x and Windows 3.51 NT servers at several client locations.  
-Installed and configured LAN hardware and software for customers needs.  
-Installed Modem Pools from Shiva and Novell as well as Faxservers from Cheyenne and Faxport.  
-Supported TCP/IP, IPX/SPX and NetBEUI protocols.  
-Performed hardware upgrades and maintenance on Compaq Proliant and Prosignia servers.  
-Primary person responsible for performing disaster recoveries at customer sites.  
-Installed and configured Aracda Backup Exec backup software.  
-Installed and supported Novell Groupwise at several customer sites.

Summary I'm a CSE @ Cisco Systems based in Brussels' Diegem office. 
 
Always keeping myself up-to-date with what lives in the industry. Requires sufficient amount of passion and discipline as well as willingness to never stop learning.  
 
I love learning about new things, especially incubating new technologies and making sure they're ready for use and absorption by the mass market. 
 
Specialties: Trace/Log/Protocol analysis, Structured troubleshooting in chaotic situations, 
Design Advisory, negotiation, building trust relationships. 
 
The nail on my coffin is product and work quality. I expect products for which I and you pay (a lot of money), to work in a good and user friendly manner, and I will always thrive to make sure my own work is from the best quality as well.  
 
If the work, or products are not according to what customers expect, I get annoyed. As a TAC engineer I'll be the first to work - as a customer advocate - with whatever relevant Business Unit to make sure products are improved for the customer. For this job I had to re-focus a bit on technologies but it shows I'm a quick learner and ready to adjust when the market transitions.
